Articles.Content:
Ever have something just outright ridiculous or amazing happen on accident in KSP? Share your stories here!.

 

Decided to bring this up, since I have found that xenon-propelled rovers are pretty nice for use on the Mun and other thin-atmosphere planets. While trying out a craft I modeled after the "Tuk-tuk" from Just Cause 2, a crash at 150 M/s resulted in the rover shattering, and the the Kerbal pilot launching out of the Mun's orbit at 2,000+ M/s.

(In case anyone is interested, this is the craft: https://kerbalx.com/Core/AAA-Ion-Tuk-tuk)

kinda relevant, but this is not just about fails

I missed a correction burn at mun and ended up in eve's soi (accidental gravity assist)
